qas.question: What does congress often grant to give rulemaking authority to federal agencies?
Federal agencies are authorized to make what public?
Regulations normally carry the force of what?
Regualtions carry force of law when based on reasonable interpretation of what?
What power is granted to federal agencies by Congress?
Why does Congress give generalized powers to federal agencies?

answers.text: too gridlocked to draft detailed statutes that explain how the agency should react to every possible situation

qas.question: What gives regulations imposed by federal agencies the right to enforce their regulations?
What does the Principle of Chevron provide for?

answers.text: regulations normally carry the force of law as long as they are based on a reasonable interpretation of the relevant statutes

qas.question: What do federal agencies enact for rulemaking purposes?
Gridlock allows Congress to draft what?
What does Congress believe hampers an agency's ability to deal with situations?
Congress's state of gridlock is referred to as what principle?
The Chevron deference prevents regulations from interpreting what?

context: Quốc hội thường xuyên <a0_0><b8_0> quy chế <b8_0/><a0_0/> cấp đó <a4_0> cơ quan quản lý rộng lớn <a4_0/> cho các cơ quan liên bang.
